member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.AutoCompleteType
member.summary: The AutomCompleteType is a string-associated enum of browser-supported autocomplete attribute values.
member.remarks: This class lists the autocomplete attirbute options allowing developers to provide the browser with guidance on how to pre-populate the form fields. It is a class rather than a simpler enum to associate each option with the string the browser expects. For more information please review the list of options (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) and the spec (https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#autofill).

member.name: F:Ellicium.Blazor.AutoCompleteType.On
member.summary: Autocomplete is enabled. The browser chooses what values to suggest.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumChart
member.summary: Displays line, area, donut, pie, bar or column series.

example.code:
<ElliciumChart>
                  <ElliciumColumnSeries Data=@revenue CategoryProperty="Quarter" ValueProperty="Revenue" />
              </ElliciumChart>
              @code {
                  class DataItem
                  {
                      public string Quarter { get; set; }
                      public double Revenue { get; set; }
                  }
                  DataItem[] revenue = new DataItem[]
                  {
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q1", Revenue = 234000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q2", Revenue = 284000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q3", Revenue = 274000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q4", Revenue = 294000 }
                  };
              }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCompareValidator
member.summary: A validator component which compares a component value with a specified value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <ElliciumPassword style="display: block" Name="Password" @bind-Value=@model.Password />
               <ElliciumPassword style="display: block" Name="RepeatPassword" @bind-Value=@model.RepeatPassword />
               <ElliciumCompareValidator Value=@model.Password Component="RepeatPassword" Text="Passwords should be the same"  Style="position: absolute" />
            </ElliciumTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                 public string Password { get; set; }
                 public double Value { get; set; }
                 public string RepeatPassword { get; set; }
               } 
               Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCompareValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCompareValidator.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value to compare with.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCompareValidator.Operator
member.summary: Specifies the comparison operator. Set to CompareOperator.Equal by default.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCustomValidator
member.summary: A validator component which compares a component value with a specified value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
                <ElliciumTextBox Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
                <ElliciumCustomValidator Value=@model.Email Component="Email" Text="Email must be unique" Validator="@(() => ValidateNewEmail(model.Email))" Style="position: absolute" />
             </ElliciumTemplateForm>
             @code {
                class Model
                {
                     public string Email { get; set; }
                }
                Model model = new Model();
            
                string[] emails = new string[] { "andy@smith" };
            
                bool ValidateNewEmail(string email)
                {
                    return !emails.Any(e => e.ToUpper().Equals(email.ToUpper()));
                }
             }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCustomValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumCustomValidator.Validator
member.summary: Specifies the function which validates the component value. Must return true if the component is valid.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumEmailValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if a component value is a valid email address. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <ElliciumEmailValidator Component="Email" Style="position: absolute" />
            </ElliciumTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
              {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumGoogleMap
member.summary: ElliciumGoogleMap component.

example.code:
<ElliciumGoogleMap Zoom="3" Center=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 42.6977, Lng = 23.3219 }) MapClick=@OnMapClick MarkerClick=@OnMarkerClick">
                <Markers>
                    <ElliciumGoogleMapMarker Title="London" Label="London" Position=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 51.5074, Lng = 0.1278 }) />
                    <ElliciumGoogleMapMarker Title="Paris " Label="Paris" Position=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 48.8566, Lng = 2.3522 }) />
                </Markers>
            </ElliciumGoogleMap>
            @code {
              void OnMapClick(GoogleMapClickEventArgs args)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"Map clicked at Lat: {args.Position.Lat}, Lng: {args.Position.Lng}");
              }
              
              void OnMarkerClick(ElliciumGoogleMapMarker marker)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"Map {marker.Title} marker clicked. Marker position -> Lat: {marker.Position.Lat}, Lng: {marker.Position.Lng}");
              }
            }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumLengthValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if then component value length is within a specified range. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="FirstName" @bind-Value=@model.FirstName />
               <ElliciumLengthValidator Component="FirstName" Min="3" Text="First name should be at least 3 characters" Style="position: absolute" />
            </ElliciumTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                  public string FirstName { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model(); 
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumLengthValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Invalid length" by default.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumLengthValidator.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum accepted length. The component value length should be greater than the minimum in order to be valid.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumLengthValidator.Max
member.summary: Specifies the maximum accepted length. The component value length should be less than the maximum in order to be valid.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumLogin
member.summary: ElliciumLogin component. Must be placed in ElliciumTemplateForm.

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm Data=@("Login")>
                     <ElliciumLogin AllowRegister="true" AllowResetPassword="true"
                                     Login=@OnLogin
                                     ResetPassword=@OnResetPassword
                                     Register=@OnRegister />
             </ElliciumTemplateForm>
             @code {
               void OnLogin(LoginArgs args, string name)
               {
                 Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Username: {args.Username} and password: {args.Password}");
               }
            
               void OnRegister(string name)
               {
                 Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Register");
               }
            
               void OnResetPassword(string value, string name)
               {
                 Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> ResetPassword for user: {value}");
               }
             }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumRegexValidator
member.summary: A validator component which matches a component value against a specified regular expression pattern. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="ZIP" @bind-Value=@model.Zip />
               <ElliciumRegexValidator Component="ZIP" Text="ZIP code must be 5 digits" Pattern="\d{5}" Style="position: absolute" />
            </ElliciumTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                  public string Zip { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model(); 
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumRegexValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumRegexValidator.Pattern
member.summary: Specifies the regular expression pattern which the component value should match in order to be valid.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumRequiredValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if a component has value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <ElliciumRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
            </ElliciumTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
             {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumRequiredValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Required" by default.

member.summary: Specifies a default value. If the component value is equal to DefaultValue it is considered invalid.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1
member.summary: Displays a collection of in day, week or month view.
member.typeparam: The type of the value item.

example.code:
<ElliciumScheduler Data="@data" TItem="DataItem" StartProperty="Start" EndProperty="End" TextProperty="Text">
                <ElliciumMonthView />
            </ElliciumScheduler>
            @code {
                class DataItem
                {
                    public DateTime Start { get; set; }
                    public DateTime End { get; set; }
                    public string Text { get; set; }
                }
                DataItem[] data = new DataItem[]
                {
                    new DataItem
                    {
                        Start = DateTime.Today,
                        End = DateTime.Today.AddDays(1),
                        Text = "Birthday"
                    },
                };
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.SlotSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks a slot in the current view. Commonly used to add new appointments.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.AppointmentSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks an appointment in the current view. Commonly used to edit existing appointments.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.AppointmentMouseEnter
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user moves the mouse over an appointment in the current view.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.AppointmentMouseLeave
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user moves the mouse out of an appointment in the current view.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.MoreSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks the more text in the current view. Commonly used to view additional appointments. Invoke the method to prevent the default action (showing the additional appointments).

example.code:
<ElliciumScheduler Data=@appointments MoreSelect=@OnMoreSelect>
            </ElliciumScheduler>
            @code {
             void OnMoreSelect(SchedulerMoreSelectEventArgs args)
             {
                args.PreventDefault();
             }
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.AppointmentRender
member.summary: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an appointment. Never call StateHasChanged when handling AppointmentRender.

example.code:
<ElliciumScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentRender=@OnAppointmentRendert>
             </ElliciumScheduler>
             @code {
               void OnAppintmentRender(SchedulerAppointmentRenderEventArgs<TItem> args)
               {
                 if (args.Data.Text == "Birthday")
                 {
                    args.Attributes["style"] = "color: red;"
                 }
            .  }
             }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.SlotRender
member.summary: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an slot. Never call StateHasChanged when handling SlotRender.

example.code:
<ElliciumScheduler Data=@appointments SlotRender=@OnSlotRender>
            </ElliciumScheduler>
            @code {
              void OnSlotRender(SchedulerSlotRenderEventArgs args)
              {
                if (args.View.Text == "Month" && args.Start.Date == DateTime.Today)
                {
                   args.Attributes["style"] = "background: red;";
                }
              }
            }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.LoadData
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the scheduler needs data for the current view. Commonly used to filter the data assigned to .

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumScheduler`1.AppointmentMove
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when an appointment is being dragged and then dropped on a different slot. Commonly used to change it to a different timeslot.

example.code:
<ElliciumScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentMove=@OnAppointmentMove>
            </ElliciumScheduler>
            @code {
              async Task OnAppointmentMove(SchedulerAppointmentMoveEventArgs moved)
              {
                var draggedAppointment = appointments.SingleOrDefault(x => x == (Appointment)moved.Appointment.Data);
                if (draggedAppointment != null)
                {
                    draggedAppointment.Start = draggedAppointment.Start + moved.TimeSpan;
                    draggedAppointment.End = draggedAppointment.End + moved.TimeSpan;
                    await scheduler.Reload();
                }
              }
            }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1
member.summary: Displays a text label for the specified data item from the series.

example.code:
<ElliciumChart>
                  <ElliciumLineSeries Data=@revenue CategoryProperty="Quarter" ValueProperty="Revenue">
                     <ElliciumSeriesAnnotation Data="@revenue[1] Text="Q2 Revenue" />
                  </ElliciumLineSeries>
              </ElliciumChart>
              @code {
                  class DataItem
                  {
                      public string Quarter { get; set; }
                      public double Revenue { get; set; }
                  }
                  DataItem[] revenue = new DataItem[]
                  {
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q1", Revenue = 234000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q2", Revenue = 284000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q3", Revenue = 274000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q4", Revenue = 294000 }
                  };
              }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1.Data
member.summary: The data item from the series this annotation applies to.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1.Text
member.summary: The text to display in the annotation.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1.OffsetX
member.summary: Horizontal offset from the default position.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1.OffsetY
member.summary: Vertical offset from the default position.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1.Visible
member.summary: Determines whether the annotation is visible. Set to true by default.

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumSeriesAnnotation`1.Series
member.summary: The series this annotation applies to. Set to true by default.

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTemplateForm`1
member.summary: A component which represents a form. Provides validation support.

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
               <ElliciumRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
             </ElliciumTemplateForm>
             @code {
              class Model
              {
                public string Email { get; set; }
              }
            
              Model model = new Model();
             }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTemplateForm`1.IsValid
member.summary: Returns the validity of the form.
member.value: true if all validators in the form a valid; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Specifies the model of the form. Required to support validation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the child content.

member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is true.

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Submit=@OnSubmit Data=@model>
               <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
               <ElliciumRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
             </ElliciumTemplateForm>
             @code {
              class Model
               {
                public string Email { get; set; }
              }
            
              Model model = new Model();
            
              void OnSubmit(Model value)
              {
            
              }
             }

member.summary: Obsolete. Use instead.

member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is false.

example.code:
<ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" InvalidSubmit=@OnInvalidSubmit Data=@model>
               <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
               <ElliciumRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
             </ElliciumTemplateForm>
             @code {
              class Model
              {
                public string Email { get; set; }
              }
            
              Model model = new Model();
            
              void OnInvalidSubmit(FormInvalidSubmitEventArgs args)
              {
            
              }
             }

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTemplateForm`1.Method
member.summary: Specifies the form method attribute. Used together with .

example.code: <ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <ElliciumRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </ElliciumTemplateForm>

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTemplateForm`1.Action
member.summary: Specifies the form action attribute. When set the form submits to the specified URL.

example.code: <ElliciumTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <ElliciumTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <ElliciumRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </ElliciumTemplateForm>

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTree
member.summary: A component which displays a hierarchy of items. Supports inline definition and data-binding.

example.code: <ElliciumTree> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="BMW"> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="M3" /> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="M5" /> </ElliciumTreeItem> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="Audi"> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="RS4" /> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="RS6" /> </ElliciumTreeItem> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="Mercedes"> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="C63 AMG" /> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="S63 AMG" /> </ElliciumTreeItem> </ElliciumTree>

member.name: P:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTree.Change
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user selects an item.

example.code:
<ElliciumTree Change=@OnChange> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="BMW"> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="M3" /> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="M5" /> </ElliciumTreeItem> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="Audi"> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="RS4" /> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="RS6" /> </ElliciumTreeItem> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="Mercedes"> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="C63 AMG" /> <ElliciumTreeItem Text="S63 AMG" /> </ElliciumTreeItem> </ElliciumTree> @code { void OnChange(TreeEventArgs args) {
} }

} }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumTreeLevel
member.summary: Configures a level of nodes in a during data-binding.

example.code:
<ElliciumTree Data=@rootEmployees>
                <ElliciumTreeLevel TextProperty="LastName" ChildrenProperty="Employees1"  HasChildren=@(e => (e as Employee).Employees1.Any()) />
            </ElliciumTree>
            @code {
             IEnumerable<Employee> rootEmployees; 
             protected override void OnInitialized()
             {
                rootEmployees = NorthwindDbContext.Employees.Where(e => e.ReportsTo == null);
             }
            }

member.name: T:Ellicium.Blazor.ElliciumUpload
member.summary: ElliciumUpload component.

example.code:
<ElliciumUpload Url="upload/single" Progress=@(args => OnProgress(args, "Single file upload"))/>
             @code {
              void OnProgress(UploadProgressArgs args, string name)
              {
                this.info = $"% '{name}' / {args.Loaded} of {args.Total} bytes.";
                this.progress = args.Progress;
                if (args.Progress == 100)
                {
                    console.Clear();
            
                    foreach (var file in args.Files)
                    {
                        console.Log($"Uploaded: {file.Name} / {file.Size} bytes");
                    }
                }
              }
             }

member.name: T:Ellicium.NotificationService
member.summary: Class NotificationService. Contains various methods with options to open notifications. Should be added as scoped service in the application services and ElliciumNotification should be added in application main layout.

example.code: @inject NotificationService NotificationService <ElliciumButton Text="Show info notification" Click=@(args => NotificationService.Notify(new NotificationMessage { Severity = NotificationSeverity.Info, Summary = "Info Summary", Detail = "Info Detail", Duration = 4000 })) / >

member.summary: Gets the messages.

member.summary: Notifies the specified message.

member.summary: Notifies the specified severity.
member.param: If true, then the notification will be closed when clicked on.
Used to store a custom payload that can be retreived later in the click event handler.
Action to be executed on close.
